alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Southwest Utah; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 13 at 3:07PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Central Mountains, Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains and Southwest Utah. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, slick rock areas, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Debris flows could develop due to heavy rain over recent burn scars including Bald Mountain/Pole Creek, Dollar Ridge, East Fork, and Trail Mountain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The remnants of Tropical Storm Kay will move across Utah today, bringing deep tropical moisture and ample instability that will aid in the development of showers and thunderstorms. Any storms that develop have the potential to produce very heavy rainfall capable of producing flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Mountains; Southwest Utah; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains
